contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=March 2009}} The '''Zerewitinoff determination''' or '''Zerevitinov determination''' is a quantitative [[chemical test]] for the determination of [[active hydrogen]]s in a [[chemical substance]]. A sample is treated with the [[Grignard reaction|Grignard reagent]], [[methylmagnesium iodide]], which reacts with any acidic hydrogen atom to form [[methane]]. This gas can be determined quantitatively.
